basics.name: Ian Pan
basics.label: Radiologist
basics.summary: Radiologist, deep learning practitioner, waiting for AI to replace me

work.name: Brigham and Women's Hospital
work.summary: Responsibilities include: image interpretation, image-guided procedures, exam protocolling, communication with ordering providers, interdisplinary conferences

work.name: University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center
work.summary: Performed the duties of a first-year preliminary medical intern, providing care for inpatients at University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center and the Cleveland Veterans Affairs Medical Center
highlights: Awarded Preliminary Intern of the Year

work.name: Freelance AI Consulting
work.summary: Provide consulting services for companies related to healthcare (primarily medical imaging) and AI, including MD.ai, Dasa, and Centaur Labs

work.name: Data Science for Social Good
work.summary: Developed a machine learning algorithm alongside the Illinois Department of Public Health to predict risk of adverse birth outcomes in underserved pregnant women to guide allocation of limited resources
highlights: Published manuscript in the American Journal of Public Health: https://ajph.aphapublications.org/doi/abs/10.2105/AJPH.2017.303711

education.institution: The Warren Alpert Medical School of Brown University

awards.title: MIDRC XAI Grand Challenge 1st Place Winner
awards.awarder: Medical Imaging and Data Resource Center
awards.summary: 1st place winner in this competition to produce explainable AI predictions for pneumonia in chest radiographs

awards.title: RSNA Lumbar Spine Degenerative Classification AI Challenge 2nd Place Winner
awards.summary: Part of 2nd place team in the 2024 RSNA AI challenge hosted on Kaggle

awards.title: MIDRC mRALE Mastermind Challenge 1st Place Winner
awards.awarder: Medical Imaging and Data Resource Center
awards.summary: 1st place in this competition to predict COVID severity on chest radiographs

awards.title: RSNA Abdominal Trauma Detection AI Challenge 8th Place Winner
awards.summary: 8th place in the 2023 RSNA AI challenge hosted on Kaggle

awards.title: RSNA Screening Mammography Breast Cancer Detection AI Challenge 4th Place Winner
awards.summary: Part of 4th place team in the 2023 RSNA AI challenge hosted on Kaggle

awards.title: RSNA Cervical Spine Fracture AI Challenge 6th Place Winner
awards.summary: 6th place in the 2022 RSNA AI challenge hosted on Kaggle

awards.title: COVID-19 AI Detection Challenge 3rd Place Winner
awards.awarder: Radiological Society of North America, Society for Imaging Informatics in Medicine, Foundation for the Promotion of Health and Biomedical Research of Valencia Region
awards.summary: Part of 3rd place duo in this competition hosted on Kaggle

awards.title: The Willard A. Bernbaum Award
awards.awarder: Case Western Reserve University School of Medicine
awards.summary: Awarded by the Department of Medicine to 2 exemplary preliminary interns in Internal Medicine per year

awards.title: RSNA Pulmonary Embolism Detection Challenge 2nd Place Winner
awards.summary: 2nd place in this competition hosted on Kaggle, also received the Educational Merit Award

awards.title: RSNA Trainee Research Prize in Neuroradiology
awards.summary: Awarded for scientific abstract, Fully-Automated Identification and Characterization of Large Vessel Occlusions on CT Angiography with 3D Convolutional Neural Networks, under the mentorship of Dr. Harrison Bai

awards.title: Radiological Society of Rhode Island Prize
awards.awarder: Radiological Society of Rhode Island, Warren Alpert Medical School
awards.summary: Awarded to two graduating medical students who have completed a radiology elective, shown significant interest in radiology during the elective and knowledge in radiology considered to be greater than his/her colleagues

awards.title: RSNA Pneumonia Detection Challenge 1st Place Winner
awards.summary: Part of 1st place duo in this competition hosted on Kaggle

awards.title: RSNA Trainee Research Prize in Informatics
awards.summary: Awarded for scientific abstract, Predicting Thyroid Malignancy with Efficient Convolutional Neural Networks, under the mentorship of Drs. Michael Beland and Derek Merck

awards.title: RSNA Pediatric Bone Age Challenge 2nd Place Winner
awards.summary: 2nd place in the inaugural RSNA AI challenge

awards.title: The Milton Hamolsky Prize
awards.awarder: Program in Liberal Medical Education, Brown University
awards.summary: Awarded to the PLME student who has best utilized the potentialities inherent in the PLME to pursue scholarly interests in the natural sciences which will enhance and enrich the studentâ€™s career as a physician
